result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio Henry Fortune was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
SENTENCE STAYED TO 01-21-2015.  Defendant filed completion proof of 25 hours of community service; sentence STAYED for defendent to provide completion of an additional 40 hours of community service at an non-profitable organization, and payment proof of all costs, assessments and surcharges.
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.

At an non-profit facility (provide proof of service on 1-21-2015)
The Court will keep matter for review in 6 months (1-21-2015) at 8"15 a/m.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio Henry Fortune

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Antonio Henry Fortune in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has completed the 40 additional hours of community service and the financial obligations have been paid.  Court will permanently STAY the sentence of 60 days HOC and find it to be satisfied.

Matter is set for review on today's date.  Court is in trial.
Atty Carpenter contacts the court and states that he has a home repair emergency this morning.
Defendant has not checked in as of 9am.  There is no appearance by the state.
Atty Carpenter requests that matter be adjourned until 1-23-2015 when defendant has another court appearance on a pending OWI matter.
Court will STAY a bench warrant to 1-23-2015 at 8:15am.
Proof of completion of additional community service has been filed with the court.
Letter From Spirit Goverened Church & Ministries Confirming Community Service

Defendant Antonio Henry Fortune in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD FOR BR. 26
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Proof of 25 hours of community service filed.
The Court will impose 60 days at the House of Correction, credit for 4 days, and will STAY sentence for 6 months to allow the defendant to complete an additional 40 hours of community service at a non-profit charitable organization and to provide proof and to also pay all the costs, assessments and surcharges, DNA surcharge and DNA sample and payment and to provide proof.  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  
The Court will keep matter for review in 6 months on 1-21-2015 at 8:15 for review hearing.

Defendant Antonio Henry Fortune in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Chojnacki).  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antonio Henry Fortune in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Court in jury trial this date; case rescheduled.  Plea hearing scheduled for 07-01-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antonio Henry Fortune in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/2/14.

14RM022721  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04-27-14

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Antonio Henry Fortune in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Antonio Henry Fortune in custody.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
